description.value:
Trigger At least two creatures enter the area

Effect The earth shifts wildly as the hands of the dead spring forth from the ground. The area becomes difficult terrain. Creatures within the area are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Prone] unless they succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

details.description: Hands of the buried dead rise from the ground, grabbing and tearing at creatures in the area to drag them underground.
details.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:22] (trained) to ritually pray for the dead or @Check[type:occultism|dc:24] (trained) to exorcise the spirits' anger; two total successes are required to disable the haunt
details.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all living creatures leave the area. After 1 hour, the haunt reactivates.
details.routine: (1 action) The grasping hands batter all creatures in the area, dealing [[/r (2d6+7)[bludgeoning]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, a creature is dragged partially into the earth, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Immobilized] until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Escape]{Escapes} (DC 26). If already immobilized, it's fully submerged and must hold its breath to avoid suffocation.
